definition: to take up a challenge/to face an attack and meet it
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
surname Ying
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
to fight/fight/war/battle
to remain calm in the face of adversity (idiom)

sentences.english: Life is a long journey, challenges keep pace with opportunites during this journey.
sentences.chinese: 生命是一场短途游览，在旅途上有应战和机缘。

sentences.english: Be thankful for each new challenge, because it will build your strength and character.
sentences.chinese: 感激每一次新的应战，由于它会塑造你的个性和力量。

sentences.english: The school challenged us to a game of football.
sentences.chinese: 那所黉舍向本人们应战赛场足球。

sentences.english: But did pull out the sword yingzhen jie, but was soon down.
sentences.chinese: 胤杰无奈拔剑应战，但很快就被打倒。

sentences.english: We met an enemy attack calmly under the direction of the general.
sentences.chinese: 我们在将军的指挥下沉着应战。

sentences.english: Forty-five minutes is a long, long time to play with ten men.
sentences.chinese: 对10人应战来说四十五分钟是很久的。

sentences.english: The Wuchang let the fortune teller to write with notices.
sentences.chinese: 那五常让算命先生代写应战告示。

sentences.english: Or can these two hotties work it out?
sentences.chinese: 还有这两位美能否从容应战？

sentences.english: It buckled like a graham cracker.
sentences.chinese: 这就像一个全麦饼干沉着应战。

sentences.english: In order to hold the north and zheng, JiXin bear the tone this action.
sentences.chinese: 为了和郑北执这口吻，齐欣承受了这个应战。

sentences.english: The next day, the physical team intense battle.
sentences.chinese: 第二天白天，方天翼的队伍紧张的应战。

sentences.english: And he came out with three thousand footmen, and four hundred horsemen.
sentences.chinese: 哥尔基雅率领三千步兵，四百骑兵出来应战。

sentences.english: This represents a serious challenge to condiments marketers.
sentences.chinese: 这表现了严重应战调味操行销。

definition: to besiege/to beleaguer/to attack from all sides/to jointly speak or write against sb
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
to put one's all into the fight
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
decisive battle/to fight a decisive battle/to fight for supremacy in ...
to concede/to admit defeat
powerful enemy
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to start a war/to make war/to battle against
to engage in battle
multitude of enemies, few friends (idiom from Mencius)/heavily outnumbered/beaten by the weight of numbers
to challenge an opponent to a fight
to sally/to attack
to do battle (with sb)
to fight/to wage war
to attack violently/to storm
